item.title: Nelson Bighetti
item.description:
I was a researcher in the <a href="http://3dgeoinfo.bk.tudelft.nl/">3D geoinformation research group</a>, at the Delft University of Technology, in the Netherlands. I hold a PhD degree in Geomatics (graduated on 9 June 2015). My PhD research topic was "Navigation for first responders", which was supervised by <a href="https://research.unsw.edu.au/people/professor-sisi-zlatanova">prof.dr. S. Zlatanova</a> (co-promotor) and <a href="http://www.gdmc.nl/oosterom/">Prof. dr. ir. P.J.M. van Oosterom </a> (promotor). In my PhD study, I focused on the approaches supporting path planning for first responder in the presence of moving obstacles. More details of my research can be found <a href="http://3dgeoinfo.bk.tudelft.nl/projects/navigation/">here.
